pull.title: [rpc] mining: Omit uninitialized currentblockweight, currentblocktx
pull.body: Previously we'd report "0", which could be mistaken for a valid number. E.g. the number of transactions is 0 or the block weight is 0, whatever that means.

rename.from: [rpc] mining: Report -1 for uninitialized currentblockweight and currentblocktx
rename.to: [rpc] mining: Report -1 for uninitialized currentblockweight, currentblocktx

events.body: This should probably have release notes
I am happy to write them after this is merged
Concept ACK, change looks good too. Could have a test for -1 values?

rename.from: [rpc] mining: Report -1 for uninitialized currentblockweight, currentblocktx
rename.to: [rpc] mining: Report null for uninitialized currentblockweight, currentblocktx

events.body: Added release notes, removed leftover variables, run clang format, ... Should be ready
Why not omit the fields entirely?

Omitting the fields was also my intuition (just going off the first line of the PR description).  It's true that some software might not handle omitted fields well, but the same stuff would probably not handle the special json null either.

@luke-jr @gmaxwell it was suggested before https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15383#discussion_r255667351. Since it's an edge case, once set it's always present, I tend to prefer null value.

utACK fa3c0da.

[rpc] mining: Omit uninitialized currentblockweight, currentblocktx

events.body: Made it to omit the key-value altogether

issue.title: v4.5.1-1 getmininginfo() rpc always returns 0 for currentblocksize and currentblocktx
issue.body:
Once the zcashd v4.5.1-1 node is synced, it has been noticed that the getmininginfo RPC is always returning 0 for values in the currentblocksize and currentblocktx:

```
zcash-cli getmininginfo
{
  "blocks": 1451236,
  "currentblocksize": 0,
  "currentblocktx": 0,
  "difficulty": 68204613.96796055,
  "errors": "",
  "errorstimestamp": 1636236195,
  "genproclimit": 1,
  "localsolps": 0,
  "networksolps": 7079199125,
  "networkhashps": 7079199125,
  "pooledtx": 9,
  "testnet": false,
  "chain": "main",
  "generate": false
}
```
Checking from another RPC: `getblock -1` produces:
```
zcash-cli getblock -1
{
  "hash": "00000000005ee6ae20497493ee65830cd9e46a3d37dbc2baa1da880eef0f8714",
  "confirmations": 1,
  "size": 12522,
  "height": 1451236,
  "version": 4,
  ....
  "tx": [
    "aec0309f154f91ad8cc33648e57ddf554816bef5846d507c095b8452fbdf2f2d",
    "7ac3ac4282576dd6d150facb5b7598692c20fc0f5126589e34679445c84e2be1",
    "5521a8d3239dc70ee2fb97635ca6f2bc2a8e3554387f439a72cd07edaf6ce1db",
    "6cd0a77dcc40b1c941a6bf1c804df302b8de4f1902a8744d3755ddeb8027bb1e",
    "2c22708d38b74cee6ad8b4dc74b9e70802c01ae34d010688351e2af1122072d5",
    "135a80ba26afa14bdb114bb181714814af2d8504cdb7a4dd8011ae5e76892a5a",
    "07c8d4f8256685faeae2ec8f075fc6f2ea4ef5f42de3369555c8d8c6c773fa73",
    "cc808b6a89e324784ff0e03de1bd84b89730e529661fddaa19eb7aef81698585",
    "6308fd1fd6789a837a8899f423b58b2ba3a073227d9f86d5557fdc2aa5908e03",
    "a22b85c61e0fe9670be15ede6716fcf428e40191eab688136741a703928f1d46",
    "cc8bf558bc212aeeb4db9563ccc2804af04970398f6e88517d462d5b556eccb7",
    "3a68ca6e9cdb45c4e5be5677ae7cd818cd2da39ec8873c2b89357e853bb353e6",
    "c331ba6858708030fcb5d61b63b93365a45854b7e54ed69aeaf8691c730fa5e2",
    "17d206d270ae1ebc98363f21c7d30d74a2205315dcfd691f3577eebcc9bee77f"
  ],

```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -187,36 +187,36 @@ static UniValue generatetoaddress(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
 
 static UniValue getmininginfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
 {
-    if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 0)
+    if (request.fHelp || request.params.size() != 0) {
         throw std::runtime_error(
             RPCHelpMan{"getmininginfo",
                 "\nReturns a json object containing mining-related information.",
                 {},
                 RPCResult{
-            "{\n"
-            "  \"blocks\": nnn,             (numeric) The current block\n"
-            "  \"currentblockweight\": nnn, (numeric) The last block weight\n"
-            "  \"currentblocktx\": nnn,     (numeric) The last block transaction\n"
-            "  \"difficulty\": xxx.xxxxx    (numeric) The current difficulty\n"
-            "  \"networkhashps\": nnn,      (numeric) The network hashes per second\n"
-            "  \"pooledtx\": n              (numeric) The size of the mempool\n"
-            "  \"chain\": \"xxxx\",           (string) current network name as defined in BIP70 (main, test, regtest)\n"
-            "  \"warnings\": \"...\"          (string) any network and blockchain warnings\n"
-            "}\n"
+                    "{\n"
+                    "  \"blocks\": nnn,             (numeric) The current block\n"
+                    "  \"currentblockweight\": nnn, (numeric) The block weight of the last assembled block (or -1 if no block was ever assembled)\n"
comments.body: Just noting that we could omit these keys instead of `-1`.

comments.body:
They are not optional in a sense that they could be omitted.

The type is either numeric or null-type, but I don't think we document this in other places

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,9 @@ in the Low-level Changes section below.
 
 - See the [Mining](#mining) section for changes to `getblocktemplate`.
 
+- The `getmininginfo` RPC now returns `null` for `currentblockweight` and
+  `currentblocktx` when a block was never assembled via an RPC on this node.
